oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill of Recitations for the Twentieth Session of the Nashville Female Academy, Commencing January 22d and ending June 21st, 1827

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside listing the names, residences and statistics for students of the 20th Session of the Nashville Female Academy in 1827.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Private Schools; Women; Education
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Nashville Female Academy opened in 1816 and prospered through the eve of the Civil War, boasting enrollment of upwards of 500 students during its peak. In 1862, part of the structure was used as a hospital and occupied by Union troops until the end of the war. It reopened as Lanier Female Academy and finally closed in 1878.
